headline: Lennox Commercial HVAC Push Puts New Distribution And Digital Tools To Test
summary: Lennox International (NYSE:LII) has opened its largest distribution center to support its commercial HVAC business. The company has introduced upgraded digital tools for contractors and dealers to manage orders and service needs. These moves represent fresh investment aimed at improving distribution efficiency and customer experience in commercial HVAC. Lennox International, best known for heating, ventilation and air conditioning systems, is putting fresh weight behind its commercial HVAC...

headline: Lennox International Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Lennox International (NYSE:LII) reported fourth-quarter and full-year 2025 results that reflected weaker end markets and channel destocking, while management emphasized record full-year profitability and outlined expectations for a return to revenue growth in 2026. headline: Compared to Estimates, Lennox (LII) Q4 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics
summary: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Lennox (LII) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended December 2025, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.

headline: Lennox International (LII) Misses Q4 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Lennox (LII) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -6.55% and -5.88%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Lennox (NYSE:LII) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q4 CY2025 Earnings
summary: Climate control solutions innovator Lennox International (NYSE:LII) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales falling 11.2% year on year to $1.20 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $4.45 per share was 5.7% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Lennox: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: On a per-share basis, the Richardson, Texas-based company said it had profit of $4.07. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, came to $4.45 per share. The results fell short of Wall Street expectations.

headline: Lennox Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Results; Provides Full Year 2026 Guidance
summary: Lennox (NYSE: LII), a leader in energy-efficient climate-control solutions, today reported fourth quarter financial results with $1.2 billion of revenue, $196 million of operating income, and $4.07 GAAP diluted earnings per share. Accompanying financial tables reflect the change in accounting method resulting from the transition from LIFO to FIFO accounting.
